cat2873633.xml:
Answer the questions. Make notes.

Natalie thinks that repairing old things is a waste of time and money.

  • Do you agree with Natalie? Why or why not?
  • What things have you (or someone you know) invested in? Think of several examples.
  • Did you act quickly enough or were you too late?

You can tap Show to hear Natalies answer again and read along.

_self<p><object id='275355' type='audio/audio' data='S3_275355_EvDg_PE_IN_L4_U03_l03_t02d'data-author='{}' alt=''style='width: 125px;height: 125px;' /></p><p><strong>Natalie</strong></p><p>I understand this idea very well because I'm often slow to make the right investments, and then when I do, it's too late. For example, I know I should trade my old car for a new one. The payments for a new car are probably nowhere near as expensive as the repairs to my old one. They cost more than the car is worth!</p><p>It's the same thing with my fridge. It doesn't keep my food cold enough. I can't afford a new fridge, but they charge so much for repairs that I probably should invest in a new one.</p><p>These days, repairing things is too expensive. You don't save enough money and it's too much trouble. It's always better to buy something new. If you're lucky, you can take advantage of a big sale and treat yourself to something a whole lot nicer than you have now.</p>showInHeaderAll
0

cat2873634.xml:
Prepare to write: Write a first draft.

In the final task, youre going to describe a time when you (or someone you know) invested in something too late and ended up wasting time and money.

Think of at least two examples to share.

You can tap Show to see the model again.

Use your notes to write a first draft of your story.

_self<p><strong>Model</strong></p><p>I understand this idea very well because I'm often slow to make the right investments, and then when I do, it's too late. For example, I know I should trade my old car for a new one. The payments for a new car are probably nowhere near as expensive as the repairs to my old one. They cost more than the car is worth!</p><p>It's the same thing with my fridge. It doesn't keep my food cold enough. I can't afford a new fridge, but they charge so much for repairs that I probably should invest in a new one.</p><p>These days, repairing things is too expensive. You don't save enough money and it's too much trouble. It's always better to buy something new. If you're lucky, you can take advantage of a big sale and treat yourself to something a whole lot nicer than you have now.</p>showInHeaderAll
0
cat2873635.xml:
Prepare to write: Check the language.

Try to use vocabulary and grammar that youve learned in this unit in your writing:

  • expressions for talking about time and money
  • expressions for talking about prices and value
  • too and enough to describe acceptable and unacceptable things
  • expressions to modify comparisons

You can tap Show to see examples of this language in the model.

Look at your first draft. What unit language can you add? Write a second draft if it helps you.

When youre ready, go to the final task and write your story to submit to your teacher.


_self<p><b>Model</b></p> <p>I understand this idea very well because I'm often slow to make the right investments, and then when I do, it's <b>too late</b>. For example, I know I should trade my old car for a new one. The payments for a new car are probably <b>nowhere near as expensive as</b> the repairs to my old one. They cost more than the car <b>is worth</b>!</p> <p>It's the same thing with my fridge. It doesn't keep my food <b>cold enough</b>. I <b>can't afford</b> a new fridge, but they <b>charge</b> <b>so much</b> <b>for</b> repairs that I probably should <b>invest in</b> a new one.</p> <p>These days, repairing things is <b>too expensive</b>. You don't save <b>enough money</b> and it's too much trouble. It's always better to buy something new. If you're lucky, you can <b>take advantage of</b> a big sale and <b>treat yourself to</b> something <b>a whole lot nicer</b> than you have now.</p> showInHeaderAll

cat2873628.xml:
What about you?

The video explains that investing in infrastructure before things break down can prevent bigger and more expensive problems.

Can you think of examples from your life when you didnt make an investment early enough, and it cost you time and money later?

0
cat2873629.xml:
C0_0C0_3

Listen and choose all the correct answers.

Natalie is talking about investments she didnt make at the right time. Which ideas does she express?

She understands the importance of investing money at the right time.She loves her car too much to trade it in for a new one.A fridge lasts much longer if you service it once a year.Repairs are usually a waste of time and money.

0
